revised_title: Shallow Water Parasite Adaptation in Host-Parasite Interactions
tldr: Researchers conducted a reciprocal cross-infection experiment to study the adaptation of trematode parasites in host-snail interactions. They found that shallow-water parasites were more infective to shallow-water snails, suggesting gene flow by the parasite is primarily from shallow to deep habitats. This recycling and coevolution may explain the maintenance of high frequencies of sexual individuals around the shallow-water margins of the lake.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Evolution
